CVE-2011-5000.summary: The ssh_gssapi_parse_ename function in gss-serv.c in OpenSSH 5.8 and earlier, when gssapi-with-mic authentication is enabled, allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large value in a certain length field.  NOTE: there may be limited scenarios in which this issue is relevant.

CVE-2010-4478.summary: OpenSSH 5.6 and earlier, when J-PAKE is enabled, does not properly validate the public parameters in the J-PAKE protocol, which allows remote attackers to bypass the need for knowledge of the shared secret, and successfully authenticate, by sending crafted values in each round of the protocol, a related issue to CVE-2010-4252.

CVE-2014-1692.summary: The hash_buffer function in schnorr.c in OpenSSH through 6.4, when Makefile.inc is modified to enable the J-PAKE protocol, does not initialize certain data structures, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or have unspecified other impact via vectors that trigger an error condition.

CVE-2010-5107.summary: The default configuration of OpenSSH through 6.1 enforces a fixed time limit between establishing a TCP connection and completing a login, which makes it easier for remote attackers to cause a denial of service (connection-slot exhaustion) by periodically making many new TCP connections.

CVE-2017-15906.summary: The process_open function in sftp-server.c in OpenSSH before 7.6 does not properly prevent write operations in readonly mode, which allows attackers to create zero-length files.

CVE-2016-10708.summary: sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an out-of-sequence NEWKEYS message, as demonstrated by Honggfuzz, related to kex.c and packet.c.

CVE-2016-0777.summary: The resend_bytes function in roaming_common.c in the client in OpenSSH 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x before 7.1p2 allows remote servers to obtain sensitive information from process memory by requesting transmission of an entire buffer, as demonstrated by reading a private key.

CVE-2011-4327.summary: ssh-keysign.c in ssh-keysign in OpenSSH before 5.8p2 on certain platforms executes ssh-rand-helper with unintended open file descriptors, which allows local users to obtain sensitive key information via the ptrace system call.

CVE-2010-4755.summary: The (1) remote_glob function in sftp-glob.c and the (2) process_put function in sftp.c in OpenSSH 5.8 and earlier, as used in FreeBSD 7.3 and 8.1, NetBSD 5.0.2, OpenBSD 4.7, and other products, allow remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in SSH_FXP_STAT requests to an sftp daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632.

CVE-2012-0814.summary: The auth_parse_options function in auth-options.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 5.7 provides debug messages containing authorized_keys command options, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain potentially sensitive information by reading these messages, as demonstrated by the shared user account required by Gitolite.  NOTE: this can cross privilege boundaries because a user account may intentionally have no shell or filesystem access, and therefore may have no supported way to read an authorized_keys file in its own home directory.

<script type="text/javascript">//<![CDATA[
document.observe('dom:loaded', function(evt){
var v;
	if((v = Scriptaculous.Version.split('.'))  && v[1] && v[1] == 8 && v[2] && v[2] < 3){
		Effect.ScrollTo = function(element) {
			var options = arguments[1] || { },
			scrollOffsets = document.viewport.getScrollOffsets(),
			elementOffsets = $(element).cumulativeOffset(),
			max = document.viewport.getScrollOffsets[0] - document.viewport.getHeight();
			if (options.offset) elementOffsets[1] += options.offset;
			return new Effect.Tween(null,
		 		scrollOffsets.top,
		 		elementOffsets[1] > max ? max : elementOffsets[1],
		 		options,
		 		function(p){ scrollTo(scrollOffsets.left, p.round()) }
			);
		};
	}
	var anchors = $$('a').reject(function(elm){ return (elm.up('.controls') || elm.className.match(/carousel/)); });
	anchors.each(function(elm){
		var ref = elm.href.split(/#/)[1];
		var t = (!!$(ref)) ? $(ref) : anchors.find(function(em){ return em.name == ref; });
		if(t){
			elm.observe('click',function(evt){
				evt.stop();
				Effect.ScrollTo(t, {duration:'0.6', offset:-130});
			});
		}
	});
});
document.observe('dom:loaded',function(){
	var sticker = $("navbanner");
	var origin = sticker.cumulativeOffset();
	var width = document.viewport.getWidth();
	var offset = 0;
	var test = new Element('div',{style:'position:fixed'});
	var cantBeFixed = (Prototype.Browser.MobileSafari || test.style.position.toLowerCase() != 'fixed');
	sticker['_style'] = sticker.readAttribute('style');
	function stick(){
		var scrolled = document.viewport.getScrollOffsets()[1];
		if(scrolled >= (origin['top'] - offset)){
			if(cantBeFixed){
				sticker.setStyle({"top":(scrolled + offset + (sticker.positionedOffset()['top'] - sticker.cumulativeOffset()['top'])) + "px"});
			}else{
				if(!sticker.stuck){
					sticker.setStyle('position:fixed; top:' + offset + 'px; left:' + origin['left'] + 'px;');
					sticker['stuck'] = true;
				}
			}
		}else{
			sticker.writeAttribute('style',sticker._style);
			sticker.stuck = false;
		}
	}
	Event.observe(window, 'resize', function(evt){
		sticker.writeAttribute('style',sticker._style);
		sticker.stuck = false;
		origin = sticker.cumulativeOffset();
		stick();
	});
	Event.observe(window,'scroll', function(evt){
		stick();
	});
});

		<div id="item8"><div id="fbtag"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/BlackNBlue" target="_blank" title="Black-N-Blue on Facebook Fan Page"><img src="Resources/fbtag.png" border=0 width=124 height=61 alt="fbtag" style="float:left"></a>
			</div>
			<div id="myspacetag"><a href="http://www.myspace.com/blacknblueofficial" target="_blank" title="Black-N-Blue on MySpace"><img src="Resources/myspacetag.png" border=0 width=125 height=66 alt="myspacetag" style="float:left"></a>
			</div>
		</div>
		<div id="item1"><iframe width="640" height="360" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/wiUF-8Mh8Vc" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe></div>
		<div id="item20"><iframe width="640" height="360" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/ZnVTjwruEEc" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
</div>
		<div id="item7"><p class="style29 f-fp">80’s hard rockers, Black ‘N Blue were formed in 1981 and released four successful and critically acclaimed albums through Geffen Records including their self-titled debut (1984),“Without Love” (1985), “Nasty Nasty” (1986), and “In Heat” (1987), with the latter two albums produced by the legendary Gene Simmons of KISS. The band, which featured Jaime St. James (vocals), Tommy Thayer (lead guitar, and currently performing with KISS as the replacement for Ace Frehley), Jef “Woop” Warner (guitar), Patrick Young (bass), and Pete Holmes (drums), started in Portland, OR as a group of friends that came together to make their mark on 80’s hard rock. The band eventually relocated to Los Angeles and was signed to Geffen Records.</p>
			<p class="style29">Black ‘N Blue would go on to sell over a million albums throughout their tenure in the 80’s. The band scored a hit single in “Hold On To 18” (which was featured on the group’s first release), a track that is widely known as a hard rock classic and still garners airplay on stations across the country. Their 2nd single (off Without Love) Miss Mystery was a great success for the band. In addition, the band toured relentlessly with the likes of KISS, Aerosmith, Queensryche, Night Ranger, Yngwie Malmsteen, among other platinum acts.</p>
			<p class="style29">In early 2003, vocalist Jaime St. James reformed Black ‘N Blue. Joining St. James were original members Warner, Holmes and Young along with new guitarist Shawn Sonnenschein. The band began recording a new album titled “Hell Yeah!” Recording of the album came to a halt when Jaime St. James joined Warrant as their new lead vocalist in February of 2004. Jaime toured the world with Warrant for four years.</p>
			<p class="style29 f-lp">In 2008, plans to get back into the studio and finish the “Hell Yeah!” album were underway, as well as festival appearances and other touring. The new album (on Frontiers Records) is described as “classic” Black ‘N Blue as heard on the group’s original recordings and promises not to disappoint." In 2012 BNB performed on the massively successful Monsters of Rock Cruise with Cinderella, Tesla, UFO, Kix, and many more…they will be back on the cruise in 2013! 30 years of rock, 4 out of five original members, and still kickin’ ass!</p>
		</div>
		<div id="item6"><p class="f-fp f-lp"><strong><span class="style1"><a name="Band"></a><span class="style20"><img src="Resources/item6.gif" border=0 width=418 height=26 alt="History of THE BAND"></span></span></strong></p>
		</div>
		<div id="item6a1"><p class="f-fp f-lp"><strong><span class="style21"><img src="Resources/item6a1.gif" border=0 width=403 height=21 alt="black -n- blue AT-A-GLANCE"></span></strong></p>
		</div>
		<div id="item6b"><p class="f-fp f-lp"><strong><span class="style1"><a name="Music"></a><span class="style20"><img src="Resources/item6b.gif" border=0 width=363 height=26 alt="MUSIC (discograpy)"></span></span></strong></p>
		</div>
		<div id="bnbsmpic"><img src="Resources/bnbsmpic.jpeg" border=0 width=342 height=292 alt="bnbsmpic" style="float:left">
		</div>
		<div id="item14"><img src="Resources/item14.gif" border=0 width=283 height=354 alt="item14" style="float:left">
		</div>
		<div id="item6a"><p class="f-fp f-lp"><strong><span class="style21"><img src="Resources/item6a.gif" border=0 width=134 height=20 alt="The band:"></span></strong></p>
		</div>
		<div id="item9"><p class="bodycopy f-fp">JAIME ST. JAMES (VOCALS)</p>
			<p class="bodycopy"><span class="style4">BRANDON COOK</span> (GUITAR)</p>
			<p class="bodycopy"><span class="style38">BOBBY CAPKA</span> (GUITAR)</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">PATRICK YOUNG (BASS)</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">PETE HOLMES (DRUMS)</p>
			<p class="bodycopy f-lp"><em><span class="style48">MISSING IN ACTION: <br></span></em><span class="style48">TOMMY THAYER (CURRENTLY IN KISS)<br>JEF "WOOP" WARNER</span></p>
		</div>
		<div id="item11"><p class="style7 f-fp f-lp"><strong><img src="Resources/item11.gif" border=0 width=141 height=12 alt="CONNECT WITH US"></strong></p>
		</div>
		<div id="item12"><p class="bodycopy f-fp">•	F<span class="style4">ormed in the fall of</span> 1981</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	S<span class="style4">igned to</span> GEFFEN RECORDS <span class="style4">in </span>1983</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	B-N-B <span class="style4">self-titled</span> <span class="style4">record recorded</span> <span class="style4">in Germany</span> <span class="style4">with</span> D<span class="style4">ieter</span> D<span class="style4">irks</span> <span class="style4">of</span> SCORPIONS <span class="style4">fame</span> <span class="style4">released in</span> 1984… S<span class="style4">ingle</span> <span class="style4">and</span> MTV <span class="style4">video</span> “HOLD ON TO 18”</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	A<span class="style4">merican Tour</span> w<span class="style4">ith</span> AEROSMITH in 1984</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	2<span class="style4">nd</span> GEFFEN <span class="style4">release</span> “WITHOUT LOVE” <span class="style4">recorded in</span> V<span class="style4">ancouver,</span> BC, C<span class="style4">anada</span> <span class="style4">with Bruce</span> F<span class="style4">airbarn</span>, <span class="style4">Bob Rock</span> <span class="style4">and</span> M<span class="style4">ike Frasier, released</span> in 1985…S<span class="style4">ingle</span> <span class="style4">and</span> MTV <span class="style4">video</span> “MISS MISTERY”</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	A<span class="style4">merican Tour</span> <span class="style4">with</span> KISS <span class="style4">on</span> A<span class="style4">SYLUM</span> TOUR in 1985</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	3<span class="style4">rd</span> GEFFEN RECORDS<span class="style4"> released</span> “NASTY NASTY” <span class="style4">recorded</span> <span class="style4">in LA with</span> GENE SIMMONS <span class="style4">as producer,</span> <span class="style4">released</span> 1986…S<span class="style4">ingle</span> <span class="style4">and</span> MTV <span class="style4">video</span> “I’LL BE THERE FOR YOU” <span class="style4">written by</span> J<span class="style4">ONAT</span>HAN CANE <span class="style4">from </span>JOURNEY.</p>
		</div>
		<div id="item13"><p class="bodycopy f-fp">•	T<span class="style4">ouring with</span> DIO, QUEESRYCHE, TED NUGENT, LITA FORD, <span class="style4">and</span> NIGHT RANGER…1986</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	4<span class="style4">th</span> GEFFEN RECORDS <span class="style4">release</span> “IN HEAT” <span class="style4">produced</span> <span class="style4">by</span> GENE SIMMONS 1987</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	1996 “ONE NIGHT ONLY” LIVE <span class="style4">disk released</span></p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	2002 UNIVERSAL <span class="style4">releases</span> BLACK’N BLUE “THE ULTIMATE COLLECTION”</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	2011 “HELL YEAH” <span class="style4">the</span> 5<span class="style4">th</span> <span class="style4">studio record</span> <span class="style4">is released on</span> FRONTIERS RECORDS</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	OVER 1 MILLION RECORDS SOLD WORLD WIDE!</p>
			<p class="bodycopy">•	4 OUT OF 5 ORIGINAL MEMBERS!</p>
			<p class="bodycopy f-lp">•	P<span class="style4">layed</span> ROCKLAHOMA, M-3 FESTIVAL, ROCK THE BAYOU, MIDWEST ROCKFEST, <span class="style4">and</span> RETURNING PERFORMANCE ON THE MONSTERS OF ROCK CRUISE IN 2013</p>
		</div>
		<div id="divider1"><img src="Resources/divider1.jpeg" border=0 width=865 height=5 alt="divider1" style="float:left">
		</div>
		<div id="item6b1"><p class="f-fp f-lp"><strong><span class="style1"><a name="Videos"></a><span class="style20"><img src="Resources/item6b1.gif" border=0 width=135 height=26 alt="VIDEOS"></span></span></strong></p>
		</div>
		<div id="divider1a"><img src="Resources/divider1.jpeg" border=0 width=865 height=5 alt="divider1a" style="float:left">
		</div>
		<div id="item3">
			<table border=0 cellspacing=10 cellpadding=0>
				<tr>
					<td width=813 height=38 colspan=3 valign=top><p class="f-fp f-lp"><span class="style9"><strong>STUDIO ALBUMS<br> </strong></span></p>
					</td>
				</tr>
				<tr>
					<td width=267 height=285 valign=top><p class="style5 f-fp"><img id="album1" src="Resources/album1.jpeg" alt="album1"></p>
					<p class="style13 f-lp"><span class="style26">1984<br></span><span class="style14"><strong><span class="style27">Black 'N Blue</span></strong></span><span class="style28"><br></span><span class="style26">Geffen Records</span></p>
					</td>

					<p class="style13 f-lp"><span class="style26">1985<br></span><span class="style16"><strong><span class="style10"><em><span class="style20">Without Love<br></span></em></span></strong><span class="style15">Geffen Records</span></span></p>
					</td>
					<td width=261 valign=top><p class="style5 f-fp"><img id="album3" src="Resources/album3.jpeg" alt="album3"></p>
					<p class="style13 f-lp"><span class="style26">1986<br></span><span class="style16"><strong><span class="style10"><em><span class="style20">Nasty, Nasty<br></span></em></span></strong><span class="style15">Geffen Records</span></span></p>
					</td>
				</tr>

					</td>

					<p class="style13 f-lp"><span class="style26">2011<br></span><span class="style16"><strong><span class="style10"><em><span class="style20">Hell Yeah!<br></span></em></span></strong><span class="style15">Frontiers Records</span></span></p>
					</td>
					<td width=261 valign=top> </td>
				</tr>
				<tr>
					<td width=813 height=68 colspan=3 valign=top><p class="f-fp"> </p>

					<p class="style13 f-lp"><span class="style26">(1998)<br></span><span class="style16"><strong><span class="style10"><em><span class="style20">One Night Only: Live</span><br> </em></span></strong></span></p>
					</td>

					<p class="style13 f-lp"><span class="style26">(1998)<br></span><span class="style16"><strong><span class="style10"><em><span class="style20">Live in Detroit 1984</span><br> </em></span></strong></span></p>

					</td>
